amendatorysection.catchline: Real property taxes; tax certificates and deeds; fees of treasurer; entry on books of issuance of deed.
amendatorysection.para: The treasurer shall charge a ten-dollar issuance fee for each deed or certificate made by him or her for a sale of real property for taxes together with the fee of the notary public or other officer acknowledging the deed, but any number of items of real property bought by any one person may be included in one deed as desired by the purchaser. The issuance fee shall not be required if the tax sale certificate is issued in the name of the county, but the issuance fee is due from the purchaser when the county assigns the certificate to another person. Whenever the treasurer makes a deed to any real property sold for taxes, he or she shall enter an account thereof in the sale book opposite the description of the real property conveyed.
